attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

Undead units cannot be routed, but take damage when their Leadership is broken.
	
	Undead units also have:
	 Fear and Terror Immunity
	
	Undead units may also have their hit points restored by special characters such as the Vampire Counts Necromancer.

factionEffects.localised_description: Vorag has taken his unruly force of Ghouls and Horrors south, crossing the mountains at Black Fire Pass and carving a red trail across the Border Princes and into the Badlands. He slaughtered Orc and Goblin tribes in their thousands as he made his way towards the ruins of ancient Mourkain, where he has set up a temporary camp at Morgheim. From here, the Bloodytooth will feast on Greenskin flesh and restore to glory the long-fallen empire that was his forebearers.

effects.description: Feasting: As Vorag and his subordinates win battles, they will gather resources to rebuild the Strigos Empire.
Diplomatic relations: -60 with Greenskins

Replenishes 20% campaign movement range after winning a battle
	(all characters)
Blood kiss cost: -66% for Bloodline Strigoi rituals
Passive ability: "Frenzy" and "Gorefeast" for Strigoi Vampires

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

items.colour_text:
The stench of death hangs heavy around the Rotten Flesh Larder, a foul miasma that seems to seep from the very pores of the putrid cadavers it houses. The bodies, in various states of decay, are piled haphazardly upon one another, their rotting flesh writhing with maggots and vermin.
	
	Spikes protrude from the mass of corpses like twisted thorns, impaling the lifeless forms and holding them aloft in a grim display of brutality. Blood and ichor drip from the macabre monument, pooling at its base in a vile puddle of gore.
	
	But the Rotten Flesh Larder is more than just a grisly spectacle—it is a source of power for Vorag Bloodytooth, a conduit through which he channels the dark energies of the grave. With a gesture of his hand, Vorag can summon forth the restless spirits of the dead, calling forth swarms of ravenous ghouls to do his bidding.
	
	As the ghouls emerge from the depths of the Rotten Flesh Larder, they bring with them the stench of decay and the hunger of the grave. With eyes alight with feral hunger, they descend upon Vorag's enemies with a savage ferocity, tearing flesh from bone in a frenzied frenzy of violence.

effects.description: Hit points: +15%
Ward save: 5%
Ability: "Rotten Flesh Larder"

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Crypt Ghouls

effects.description: Attribute: Causes Terror

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

items.colour_text:
Forged from the darkest obsidian and infused with the malevolent energies of the Strigoi, each blade bears intricate runes etched along its razor-sharp edge. These runes, imbued with ancient vampiric magic, writhe and pulse with unholy power, whispering promises of dominance and destruction to their wielder.
	
	The Blades of the Fallen Empire are a matching pair, perfectly balanced and honed to perfection. Their jet-black blades gleam with a sinister sheen, reflecting the light like shards of midnight. Despite their age, they remain as sharp as the day they were forged, capable of slicing through armor and bone with ease.
	
	As symbols of the lost Strigos Empire, the Blades of the Fallen Empire serve as a reminder of a time when vampires ruled the land with an iron fist. To those who dare oppose Vorag Bloodytooth and his dark ambitions, they are harbingers of doom, heralding the return of a long-forgotten reign of terror.

effects.description: Enables magical attacks
Weapon strength: +15%
Bonus vs Infantry: +8
Charge bonus: +30
Ability: "Blades of the Fallen Empire"

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with each kill made by the unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Vorag has taken his unruly force of Ghouls and Horrors south, crossing the mountains at Black Fire Pass and carving a red trail across the Border Princes and into the Badlands. He slaughtered Orc and Goblin tribes in their thousands as he made his way towards the ruins of ancient Mourkain, where he has set up a temporary camp at Morgheim. From here, the Bloodytooth will feast on Greenskin flesh and restore to glory the long-fallen empire that was his forebearers.
